meanings.definition: A card game for two players using a reduced pack of 32 cards.
meanings.sent1: During the weekend, my friend and I enjoyed a game of piquet.
meanings.sent2: They decided to play piquet after dinner as a way to relax.
meanings.sent3: The piquet game became intense when both players were close to winning.
meanings.sent4: In the world of card games, piquet stands out for its strategic gameplay.
meanings.sent5: The sound of cards being shuffled filled the room as they prepared for a round of piquet.

meanings.definition: A pointed stake used in fortifications.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers placed a piquet to mark the boundary of the fort.
meanings.sent2: The wooden piquet was firmly driven into the ground to secure the area.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, someone painted funny faces on the piquets around the fort.
meanings.sent4: The piquets stood tall like guardians protecting the fortress.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight cast shadows of the piquets, creating an eerie atmosphere around the fort.

meanings.definition: A game of cards played by two persons with a pack of 32 cards.
meanings.sent1: Every Friday night, they gathered to play a round of piquet.
meanings.sent2: The rules of piquet were easy to learn, making it a popular choice.
meanings.sent3: During the tournament, the final match of piquet drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: The competitive spirit was high as they engaged in a game of piquet.
meanings.sent5: The winner of the piquet game celebrated with a triumphant smile.
